subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: People given a grant to do what you all are doing,
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0147_01C9CCBE.44126AC0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

" I do what I do for my own curiosity, I know it works and I can show it wo=
rks for spirit communication, but I ain't jumpin' through anyone's hoops! N=
ot for science, or any other religion!"

Yeah!! That's what I'm talking abo=
ut!!!

Not that RJ didn't have some good points, but this is the attitude I=
 believe you should have.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Su=
mption 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, May 04, 2009 1:34 PM=

  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: People given a grant to do what you all are d=
oing,






   Medical Science!? Really!? Are you FN kidding me!? A "scienc=
e" that is directly responsible for the deaths and suffering of hundreds of=
 thousands every year by the use of drugs and practices that suppsedly unde=
rwent these bogus studies for safety and effectiveness. That's your example=
 of science? Where's the "science" when you can make these studies show wha=
tever you want, or whatever someone paid for?  Science is a big fat lie! 

=
   I do what I do for my own curiosity, I know it works and I can show it w=
orks for spirit communication, but I ain't jumpin' through anyone's hoops! =
Not for science, or any other religion!

   Frank-S


  On Mon, May 4, 2009=
 at 11:13 AM, Rj <rasterer@...> wrote:




          Frank =96 I thin=
k I disagree with you here.  Science is not just about the evidence, it=92s=
 about the entire process, including how the evidence is collected and how =
(and by whom) it is interpreted.  This is why a valuable tool in the scient=
ific arsenal is the double (and triple) blind study.  It attempts to remove=
 the often uncontrollable subjectivity inherent in all people, even scienti=
sts!  Science uses this technique to help keep even itself as honest as pos=
sible.  So if you are finding that the evidence is being ignored, the reaso=
n may not be the evidence itself (no matter how compelling). It may very we=
ll be the manner in which it is collected, and interpreted: all at least as=
 important as the audio itself.

          EVP=92s are perfectly allowed to=
 throw monkey wrenches, and even kitchen sinks into scientific theories and=
 accepted dogmas: but only if they follow science=92s rules.  It=92s like t=
rying to put a new medicine on the market with claims that it destroys acce=
pted dogmas: but, if the testing has not been rigorous and up to accepted m=
edical standards, its hard to blame consumers for being doubtful of its cla=
ims.

          Science is not magic: it is a simple process really, but it=
 forces a claim to really be solidly confirmed. It seems to me that, while =
EVP research has its toe in the water of scientific methodology (it is maki=
ng observations, collecting evidence, and making theories), it seems to be =
obsessed on that phase of science, and not on the hard part: designing and =
conducting objective tests to conform or dismiss the theories.  It seems th=
at so many people are having so much fun with their audio devices and resul=
ts, that they are maybe afraid of taking it to the next step of serious tes=
ting, maybe because of the risk this testing could destroy their fun.

    =
      But they should maybe consider it might NOT destroy their fun, but in=
stead that next phase of testing may be just what the doctors ordered to br=
ing EVP into mainline science: real, science-based testing.  I fear the peo=
ple accepted as the real experts and pioneers in this field (like you Frank=
) will never get any acknowledgement of their achievements unless they have=
 are able to move into this next phase.

          Science wants you to pis=
s on its fire, Frank.  But you have to go where the fire is.   And the way =
there is through the entire scientific method, not just the early fun parts=
, but the hard testing parts.  But I understand how difficult that prospect=
 can be, and that it would take your focus off the part you seem to like be=
st (experimenting with the equipment).  If you are unable to bring yourself=
 to the testing phase, it might be worth looking at partnering up with othe=
rs who would focus on that part for you?  I think a very dynamic team of pe=
ople could be formed with you focused on the technology creation, and they =
focused on the more mundane aspects of rigorous blind study testing.  Do yo=
u think that would be valuable to you, and to the field of EVP studies? 

 =
          


          --- On Mon, 5/4/09, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@=
gmail.com> wrote:


            From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@gmail=
.com>

            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: People given a grant to do wh=
at you all are doing,

            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com

           =
 Date: Monday, May 4, 2009, 9:28 AM



             It's not that it can't =
be proven, it's that all evidence is deemed unacceptable- -a convinient way=
 to make uncompfortable facts go away.  The fact is  most of the EVP eviden=
ce pretty much contradicts, or at least throws a monkey wrench in many so c=
alled scientific theories, and accepted dogma. Even spiritualists don't acc=
ept that there's a technology for spirit communication, who needs a medium =
when you've got box?

             To me, it seems science has done little =
over the last 500 years except proclaim themsles the worlds only experts an=
d source of all knowledge. All technological advancement is made by people =
trying an idea to see what works, and running with it, not waiting for peer=
 review BS to tell her it doesn't work. Science is a bunch of fat old men s=
itting around a fire place in over stuffed chairs telling each other how sm=
art they are! They don't want anyone pissing on the fire!

             Fra=
nk-S


            On Mon, May 4, 2009 at 9:20 AM, April Abercrombie <april=
@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:





              You will never b=
e able to prove your methods scientifically, so why even try to argue with =
them? Even if you were able to, they probably still wouldn't believe it.

 =
             IMO, who cares? All that matters is that you are getting somet=
hing out of it. Besides, maybe it isn't meant to be understood by certain p=
eople. I have always held the opinion that we will never scientifically pro=
ve anything we do in the paranormal field, and I think that is no accident.=
 I think some people will never get anything out of it, while others will e=
xcel in their knowledge, but it will be all very personal.

              I=
t's all about what constitutes enough proof for you personally. You have to=
 go with your gut on what is true spirit communication, and what isn't. If =
no one ever agrees with you, so what?

              April

              -=
---- Original Message ----- 
                From: Frank Sumption 
        =
        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                Sent: Monday, May 04,=
 2009 9:07 AM
                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: People given a gra=
nt to do what you all are doing,



                 I was just sayin'!  So=
 why would anyone in this field completely ignore methods that work, irrega=
rdless of whether science accpts it? That's the thing, say anything and I'm=
 the one being negative. Question these other experts and I'm being negativ=
e--on and on. 

                 Same old story--don't accept the evidence,=
 don't accept that that someone-like me-does in fact at least understand wh=
at conditions to create to make these communications possible. Yet y'all wo=
nder why I have a case of the ass all the time. All the pompus self proclai=
med egotisical little dweebs out there chasing the damn fame and fortune--n=
ot facts.

                 I have gotten so much friggn' voices that can't=
 be explained as anything but spirits/entity communication- -not good enoug=
h! 

                 You hear that crap(any proof...) from every scientist=
/debunker- -well if the evidence was there we'd be the first to celibrate i=
t-yeah right, rihgt after they burned, burried, and debunked it. There is m=
ore than enough evidence--all of it is ignored.  

                 The stu=
ff is simple-provide something for the enitities to make their voices out o=
f and they will speak, no friggin' mystery, no magic, no secret tecnology, =
no high priest(ess) needed. 

                 Frank-S

                 
 =
               On Sun, May 3, 2009 at 7:56 PM, itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople=
@ aol.com> wrote:




                  Frank, I think you misunderstood or=
 misread something somewhere. The AAEVP/Sarah Estep Research Fund is not fo=
r AAEVP to do the research, it's for them to fund OUTSIDE organizations for=
 THEIR scientific research on the study of EVP. The Windbridge Institute re=
ceived some of this sponsor money for what they called "Real-time EVP Conve=
rsations: A Pilot Study." The method for this communication was *not* based=
 on radio sweep, nor traditional methods, so it's not based on what I assum=
e many people here are doing. And in fact, it *was* based on the creations =
of someone outside of the USA, so I'm a little confused as to why all the h=
ostility toward AAEVP for putting up the money.

                  Sadly, r=
adio sweep methods don't, and may not for a long time, get the respect of t=
he scientific community that it deserves (then again, seems no form of EVP =
does), but at least this current research is a step in the right direction.=
 I hope, when Windbridge concludes their study, that it will support the no=
tion that there is apparent communication formed in ways that cannot be exp=
lained by currently known and understood laws of nature. THAT alone, in my =
opinion, would be a big plus for all ITC communities, regardless of the met=
hod from which that communication was received. What's the old saying? "It =
takes but one white crow to prove all crows are not black." Any proof, deri=
ved from any EVP method, would be greatly welcomed as far as I'm concerned.=


                  Margaret 



                  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps .com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ ...> wrote:
                  >
 =
                 > It's the same old stuff, everyone wants to completely ig=
nore absolutely all
                  > work that has been in this field si=
nce the caveman and act like they just
                  > discovered spiri=
t and EVP. Completely ignore all the work in this country
                 =
 > and in Europe, and if anyone says anything, oh well, you're just being
 =
                 > negative! Why everyone knows there no EVP/ITC research o=
utside AAEVP!
                  > 
                  > Frank-S
            =
      > 

                  > On Sun, May 3, 2009 at 4:41 PM, Frank Sumptio=
n <purplealiengirl@ ...>wrote: 

                  >

 Yeah, it's not what you know....
                  > >
